verses.text: 因信稱義後所得的恩典所以，我們既然因信稱義，就藉著我們的主耶穌基督與 神和好；

words.note: A core theological concept: declared righteous through faith.
Often refers to Christ in a religious context.
The ideographic space '　' is a reverential marker.

verses.text: 我們也憑著信，藉著他可以進入現在所站的這恩典中，並且以盼望得享 神的榮耀為榮。

words.note: Divine favor or blessing from God.
Biblical hope is a confident expectation.
The ideographic space '　' is a reverential marker.
Refers to the majesty and splendor of God.

verses.text: 不但這樣，我們更以患難為榮；知道患難產生忍耐，

words.note: Trials or hardships for believers.
Trials or hardships for believers.
A fruit of the Spirit, enduring hardship with steadfastness.

verses.text: 忍耐產生毅力，毅力產生盼望；

words.note: A fruit of the Spirit, enduring hardship with steadfastness.
Biblical hope is a confident expectation.

verses.text: 盼望是不會令人蒙羞的，因為 神藉著所賜給我們的聖靈，把他的愛澆灌在我們的心裡。

words.note: Biblical hope is a confident expectation.
The ideographic space '　' is a reverential marker.
The third person of the Trinity.
Suggests abundant and generous pouring.

verses.text: 當我們還軟弱的時候，基督就照所定的日期，為不敬虔的人死了。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual weakness or humanity's fallen state in biblical contexts.
Forms a nominal phrase with the following verb/adjective.
Refers to a divinely appointed time in this context.

verses.text: 為義人死，是少有的；為好人死，或有敢作的；
唯有基督在我們還作罪人的時候為我們死， 神對我們的愛就在此顯明了。

words.note: Elevated character for God in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 所以，我們現在既然因他的血稱義，就更要藉著他免受 神的忿怒。

words.note: Refers to Christ's atoning sacrifice.

words.definition: to be spared from, avoid suffering

words.note: Elevated character for God in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 我們作仇敵的時候，尚且藉著 神兒子的死與他復和，既然復和了，就更要因他的生得救了！

words.note: Elevated character for God in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to reconciliation with God.
Refers to reconciliation with God.
Refers to Christ's resurrection life, leading to salvation.

verses.text: 不但這樣，我們現在已經藉著我們的主耶穌基督與 神復和，也藉著他以 神為榮。

words.note: A title of reverence for God or Christ.
Used in the structure '以 A 為 B' (take A as B).
Used in the structure '以 A 為 B' (take A as B).

verses.text: 正好像罪藉著一個人入了世界，死又是從罪來的，所以死就臨到所有人，因為所有人都犯了罪。
verses.heading: The Amplification of Justification

verses.text: 沒有律法以前，罪已經在世界上了；不過，沒有律法的時候，罪也不算罪。

words.note: Suffix indicating location.

verses.text: 可是，從亞當到摩西，死就掌權了，甚至那些不像亞當那樣犯罪的人，也在死的權下；亞當正是要來的那一位的預表。

words.note: A theological term for a person/event in the Old Testament foreshadowing Christ/New Testament events.

verses.text: 但恩賞和過犯是截然不同的；如果因著那一人的過犯，眾人都死了， 神的恩典和這一人耶穌基督在恩典裡的賞賜，對眾人就更加豐盛了。

words.note: Often combined with 更 (gèng) to emphasize 'even more'.

verses.text: 這賞賜和那一人犯罪的後果也是不同的；因為審判是由一人而來，以致定罪，恩賞卻由許多過犯而來，以致稱義。

words.note: Declaring someone righteous.

verses.text: 如果因著那一人的過犯，死就因那一人而掌權，那些蒙豐富的恩典並且得公義為賞賜的，就更要因這一位耶穌基督在生命中掌權了。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for receiving blessings.

verses.text: 這樣看來，因一次的過犯，所有人都被定罪；照樣，因一次的義行，所有人都被稱義得生命了。

words.note: Refers to a righteous deed or act.
Declared righteous by God.

verses.text: 因著那一人的悖逆，眾人就被列為罪人；照樣，因著這一人的順服，眾人也被列為義人了。

words.note: Refers to defiant disobedience.

words.definition: be counted as, be listed as
be counted as, be listed as

verses.text: 律法的出現，是要叫過犯增多；然而罪在哪裡增多，恩典就更加增多了。

words.note: Refers to the Mosaic Law or divine law.

words.definition: to want, to be going to

verses.text: 罪藉著死掌權；照樣，恩典也藉著義掌權，使人藉著我們的主耶穌基督進入永生。

words.note: Often used in a moral or religious sense.
Indicates the means or instrument by which an action is performed.
Lit. 'grasp power'.
Implies 'in the same manner'.
A key theological term.
Indicates the means or instrument by which an action is performed.
Central concept in Christian theology.
Lit. 'grasp power'.
Often functions as a causative verb.
Indicates the means or instrument by which an action is performed.
Often refers to God or Jesus in the Bible.
Transliteration of 'Jesus' and 'Christ'.
Both characters mean 'enter', emphasizing the action.
A core concept in Christian eschatology.
